name: Models in Ecology, Epidemiology and Conservation
description: Modelling is a critical tool used to address urgent resource management questions in ecology, epidemiology and conservation. This practical introduction includes approaches for modelling individuals, populations, species interactions, and communities. Applications include population viability assessments, disease eradication and climate change mitigation.
prerequisites: BIOB50H3 and [MATA29H3 or MATA30H3 or MATA31H3]
